content:
PixelFormats Class

Definition

Represents the collection of supported pixel formats.

In this Article

public static class PixelFormats
Inheritance
System.Object
PixelFormats

Inherited Members

Equals(Object)
Equals(Object,Object)
GetHashCode()
GetType()
MemberwiseClone()
ReferenceEquals(Object,Object)
ToString()

Properties

Bgr101010

Gets the Bgr101010 pixel format. Bgr101010 is a sRGB format with 32 bits per pixel (BPP). Each color channel (blue, green, and red) is allocated 10 bits per pixel (BPP).

public static System.Windows.Media.PixelFormat Bgr101010 { get; }
Value
PixelFormat

The Bgr101010 pixel format.

Remarks

XAML Attribute Usage

<object property="Bgr101010"/>

Bgr24

Gets the Bgr24 pixel format. Bgr24 is a sRGB format with 24 bits per pixel (BPP). Each color channel (blue, green, and red) is allocated 8 bits per pixel (BPP).

public static System.Windows.Media.PixelFormat Bgr24 { get; }
Value
PixelFormat

The Bgr24 pixel format.

Remarks

This format uses 24 bits of data per pixel (8 bits per pixel (BPP) for each of the three primary colors blue, green, and red). This translates to 256 shades of each primary color to provide up to 16 million colors for each image. To display Bgr24 images, the monitor and controller must be capable of displaying at least 32,000 colors.

XAML Attribute Usage

<object property="Bgr24"/>

Bgr32

Gets the Bgr32 pixel format. Bgr32 is a sRGB format with 32 bits per pixel (BPP). Each color channel (blue, green, and red) is allocated 8 bits per pixel (BPP).

public static System.Windows.Media.PixelFormat Bgr32 { get; }
Value
PixelFormat

The Bgr32 pixel format.

Remarks

XAML Attribute Usage

<object property="Bgr32"/>

Bgr555

Gets the Bgr555 pixel format. Bgr555 is a sRGB format with 16 bits per pixel (BPP). Each color channel (blue, green, and red) is allocated 5 bits per pixel (BPP).

public static System.Windows.Media.PixelFormat Bgr555 { get; }
Value
PixelFormat

The Bgr555 pixel format

Remarks

XAML Attribute Usage

<object property="Bgr555"/>

Bgr565

Gets the Bgr565 pixel format. Bgr565 is a sRGB format with 16 bits per pixel (BPP). Each color channel (blue, green, and red) is allocated 5, 6, and 5 bits per pixel (BPP) respectively.

public static System.Windows.Media.PixelFormat Bgr565 { get; }
Value
PixelFormat

The Bgr565 pixel format.

Remarks

XAML Attribute Usage

<object property="Bgr565"/>

Bgra32

Gets the Bgra32 pixel format. Bgra32 is a sRGB format with 32 bits per pixel (BPP). Each channel (blue, green, red, and alpha) is allocated 8 bits per pixel (BPP).

public static System.Windows.Media.PixelFormat Bgra32 { get; }
Value
PixelFormat

The Bgra32 pixel format.

Remarks

XAML Attribute Usage

<object property="Bgra32"/>

BlackWhite

Gets the black and white pixel format which displays one bit of data per pixel as either black or white.

public static System.Windows.Media.PixelFormat BlackWhite { get; }
Value
PixelFormat

The pixel format Black-and-White.

Remarks

XAML Attribute Usage

<object property="BlackWhite"/>

Cmyk32

Gets the Cmyk32 pixel format which displays 32 bits per pixel (BPP) with each color channel (cyan, magenta, yellow, and black) allocated 8 bits per pixel (BPP).

public static System.Windows.Media.PixelFormat Cmyk32 { get; }
Value
PixelFormat

The CMYK32 pixel format.

Remarks

The CMYK color system is often used in printing inks for paper. This type of color representation is of the form cmyk (C%, M%, Y%, K%), where C, M, Y, and K are the percent values for the cyan, magenta, yellow, and black values of the color.

XAML Attribute Usage

<object property="Cmyk32"/>

Default

Gets the pixel format that is best suited for the particular operation.

public static System.Windows.Media.PixelFormat Default { get; }
Value
PixelFormat

The PixelFormat best suited for the particular operation.

Exceptions
NotSupportedException

The PixelFormat properties are accessed.

Remarks

Default is technically not a pixel format but rather a way to access the pixel format best suited for a particular operation. This format is used for situations where the specific pixel format is not important.

XAML Attribute Usage

<object property="Default"/>

Gray16

Gets the Gray16 pixel format which displays a 16 bits-per-pixel grayscale channel, allowing 65536 shades of gray. This format has a gamma of 1.0.

public static System.Windows.Media.PixelFormat Gray16 { get; }
Value
PixelFormat

The Gray16 pixel format.

Remarks

XAML Attribute Usage

<object property="Gray16"/>

Gray2

Gets the Gray2 pixel format which displays a 2 bits-per-pixel grayscale channel, allowing 4 shades of gray.

public static System.Windows.Media.PixelFormat Gray2 { get; }
Value
PixelFormat

The Gray2 pixel format.

Remarks

XAML Attribute Usage

<object property="Gray2"/>

Gray32Float

Gets the Gray32Float pixel format. Gray32Float displays a 32 bits per pixel (BPP) grayscale channel, allowing over 4 billion shades of gray. This format has a gamma of 1.0.

public static System.Windows.Media.PixelFormat Gray32Float { get; }
Value
PixelFormat

The Gray32Float pixel format.

Remarks

XAML Attribute Usage

<object property="Gray32Float"/>

Gray4

Gets the Gray4 pixel format which displays a 4 bits-per-pixel grayscale channel, allowing 16 shades of gray.

public static System.Windows.Media.PixelFormat Gray4 { get; }
Value
PixelFormat

The Gray4 pixel format.

Remarks

XAML Attribute Usage

<object property="Gray4"/>

Gray8

Gets the Gray8 pixel format which displays an 8 bits-per-pixel grayscale channel, allowing 256 shades of gray.

public static System.Windows.Media.PixelFormat Gray8 { get; }
Value
PixelFormat

The Gray8 pixel format.

Remarks

XAML Attribute Usage

<object property="Gray8"/>

Indexed1

Gets the pixel format specifying a paletted bitmap with 2 colors.

public static System.Windows.Media.PixelFormat Indexed1 { get; }
Value
PixelFormat

The pixel format which specifying a paletted bitmap with 2 colors.

Remarks

Paletted images use a color table which determines the color usage for the image. Each pixel in the image is mapped to a particular color in the table, or palette. Each color in the palette is identified by its index number, or value, which corresponds to its position in the table. The Indexed1 pixel format has 2 colors available in the table.

XAML Attribute Usage

<object property="Indexed1"/>

Indexed2

Gets the pixel format specifying a paletted bitmap with 4 colors.

public static System.Windows.Media.PixelFormat Indexed2 { get; }
Value
PixelFormat

The pixel format which specifying a paletted bitmap with 4 colors.

Remarks

Paletted images use a color table which determines the color usage for the image. Each pixel in the image is mapped to a particular color in the table, or palette. Each color in the palette is identified by its index number, or value, which corresponds to its position in the table. The Indexed2 pixel format has 4 colors available in the table.

XAML Attribute Usage

<object property="Indexed2"/>

Indexed4

Gets the pixel format specifying a paletted bitmap with 16 colors.

public static System.Windows.Media.PixelFormat Indexed4 { get; }
Value
PixelFormat

The pixel format which specifying a paletted bitmap with 16 colors.

Remarks

Paletted images use a color table which determines the color usage for the image. Each pixel in the image is mapped to a particular color in the table, or palette. Each color in the palette is identified by its index number, or value, which corresponds to its position in the table. The Indexed4 pixel format has 16 colors available in the table.

XAML Attribute Usage

<object property="Indexed4"/>

Indexed8

Gets the pixel format specifying a paletted bitmap with 256 colors.

public static System.Windows.Media.PixelFormat Indexed8 { get; }
Value
PixelFormat

The pixel format which specifying a paletted bitmap with 256 colors.

Remarks

Paletted images use a color table which determines the color usage for the image. Each pixel in the image is mapped to a particular color in the table, or palette. Each color in the palette is identified by its index number, or value, which corresponds to its position in the table. The Indexed8 pixel format has 256 colors available in the table.

XAML Attribute Usage

<object property="Indexed8"/>

Pbgra32

Gets the Pbgra32 pixel format. Pbgra32 is a sRGB format with 32 bits per pixel (BPP). Each channel (blue, green, red, and alpha) is allocated 8 bits per pixel (BPP). Each color channel is pre-multiplied by the alpha value.

public static System.Windows.Media.PixelFormat Pbgra32 { get; }
Value
PixelFormat

The Pbgra32 pixel format.

Remarks

XAML Attribute Usage

<object property="Pbgra32"/>

Prgba128Float

Gets the Prgba128Float pixel format. Prgba128Float is a ScRGB format with 128 bits per pixel (BPP). Each channel (red, green, blue, and alpha) is allocated 32 bits per pixel (BPP). Each color channel is pre-multiplied by the alpha value. This format has a gamma of 1.0.

public static System.Windows.Media.PixelFormat Prgba128Float { get; }
Value
PixelFormat

The Prgba128Float pixel format.

Remarks

XAML Attribute Usage

<object property="Prgba128Float"/>

Prgba64

Gets the Prgba64 pixel format. Prgba64 is a sRGB format with 64 bits per pixel (BPP). Each channel (blue, green, red, and alpha) is allocated 32 bits per pixel (BPP). Each color channel is pre-multiplied by the alpha value. This format has a gamma of 1.0.

public static System.Windows.Media.PixelFormat Prgba64 { get; }
Value
PixelFormat

The Prgba64 pixel format.

Remarks

XAML Attribute Usage

<object property="Prgba64"/>

Rgb128Float

Gets the Rgb128Float pixel format. Rgb128Float is a ScRGB format with 128 bits per pixel (BPP). Each color channel is allocated 32 BPP. This format has a gamma of 1.0.

public static System.Windows.Media.PixelFormat Rgb128Float { get; }
Value
PixelFormat

The Rgb128Float pixel format.

Remarks

XAML Attribute Usage

<object property="Rgb128Float"/>

Rgb24

Gets the Rgb24 pixel format. Rgb24 is a sRGB format with 24 bits per pixel (BPP). Each color channel (red, green, and blue) is allocated 8 bits per pixel (BPP).

public static System.Windows.Media.PixelFormat Rgb24 { get; }
Value
PixelFormat

The Rgb24 pixel format.

Remarks

This format uses 24 bits of data per pixel (8 bits per pixel for each of the three primary colors red, green, and blue). This translates to 256 shades of each primary color to provide up to 16 million colors for each image.

An Rgb24 image is the same as a Bgr24 image, but the color channels (red, green, and blue) are in a different order.

XAML Attribute Usage

<object property="Rgb24"/>

Rgb48

Gets the Rgb48 pixel format. Rgb48 is a sRGB format with 48 bits per pixel (BPP). Each color channel (red, green, and blue) is allocated 16 bits per pixel (BPP). This format has a gamma of 1.0.

public static System.Windows.Media.PixelFormat Rgb48 { get; }
Value
PixelFormat

The Rgb48 pixel format.

Remarks

XAML Attribute Usage

<object property="Rgb48"/>

Rgba128Float

Gets the Rgba128Float pixel format. Rgba128Float is a ScRGB format with 128 bits per pixel (BPP). Each color channel is allocated 32 bits per pixel (BPP). This format has a gamma of 1.0.

public static System.Windows.Media.PixelFormat Rgba128Float { get; }
Value
PixelFormat

The Rgba128Float pixel format.

Remarks

XAML Attribute Usage

<object property="Rgba128Float"/>

Rgba64

Gets the Rgba64 pixel format. Rgba64 is an sRGB format with 64 bits per pixel (BPP). Each channel (red, green, blue, and alpha) is allocated 16 bits per pixel (BPP). This format has a gamma of 1.0.

public static System.Windows.Media.PixelFormat Rgba64 { get; }
Value
PixelFormat

The Rgba64 pixel format.

Remarks

XAML Attribute Usage

<object property="Rgba64"/>
